title: language_test1_14
prompt:
What is the best way to complete blank 14?

Luckily, the weather forecast is ![dropdown:Drop_Down_546_57] are not expected to drop below 50 degrees.
feedback: The correct answer is “mild. Temperatures.” The sentences should read: “Luckily, the weather forecast is mild. Temperatures are not expected to drop below 50 degrees.” “Luckily, the weather forecast is mild” is an independent clause. So is: “Temperatures are not expected to drop below 50 degrees.” Two independent clauses cannot be joined by a comma or without any punctuation. The conjunction “or” is not appropriate to describe the relationship between these clauses. The best answer is to make two separate sentences, using a period.
